places.name: Zakynthos
places.description: Greek island in the Ionian sea. Its Italian name is Zante.

persons.name: Pindar
persons.description: An Ancient Greek lyric poet from Thebes. Of the canonical nine lyric poets of ancient Greece, his work is the best preserved.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Sicily
places.description: Sicily is the largest and most populous island in the Mediterranean Sea and one of the twenty regions of Italy.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

works.name: Odes of Pindar, with several other Pieces in Prose and Verse
works.author: Pindar

persons.name: JesusChrist
persons.description: The central figure of Christianity; a first-century Jewish preacher and religious leader.

persons.name: Thucydides
persons.description: An Athenian historian and general, his History of the Peloponnesian War recounts the fifth-century BCE war between Sparta and Athens until the year 411 BCE.

persons.name: Aristotle
persons.description: A pupil of Plato's whose philosophical idealism he came to reject, arguing instead for the primacy of observations of natural phenomena. He thus established the divide between theory and experiment in science that can still be detected today. Aristotle's writings became the main way the natural world was understood from the Middle Ages to the seventeenth century, especially in the universities.

persons.name: Pliny
persons.description: The Elder. Roman army officer and author who wrote an encyclopedic Natural History. Died in the aftermath of the eruption of Vesuvius.

places.name: Sicily
places.description: Sicily is the largest and most populous island in the Mediterranean Sea and one of the twenty regions of Italy.

places.name: Aeolian Islands
places.description: sometimes referred to as the Lipari Islands after their largest island, are a volcanic archipelago in the Tyrrhenian Sea north of Sicily

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

persons.name: DiodorusSiculus
persons.description: Of Sicily was an ancient Greek historian. He is known for writing the monumental universal history Bibliotheca historica, in forty books, fifteen of which survive intact, between 60 and 30 BCE.

persons.name: Strabo
persons.description: Greek geographer, philosopher, and historian who lived in Asia Minor during the transitional period of the Roman Republic into the Roman Empire.

persons.name: JuliusCaesar
persons.description: Roman general and dictator who first landed an army in Britain. Assassinated to prevent him gaining total power in Rome.

places.name: Pompeii
places.description: An ancient city located in what is now the comune of Pompei near Naples in the Campania region of Italy. Pompeii was buried in volcanic ash in the Eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE.

places.name: Herculaneum
places.description: Herculaneum was an ancient Roman town, located in the modern-day comune of Ercolano, Campania, Italy.

persons.name: WilliamHamilton
persons.description: English diplomat, politician, antiquarian, and vulcanologist who served as the Envoy Extraordinary to the Kingdom of Naples from 1764 to 1800. FRSL.

persons.name: LazzaroSpallanzani
persons.description: Italian priest, biologist and physiologist.

places.name: Phelgrean Fields
places.description: A region of supervolcanic calderas located west of Naples, Italy.

works.name: Viaggi alle due Sicilie ed in alcune parti dell'Appennino
works.author: Lazzaro Spallanzani

works.name: Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London
works.author: William Hamilton

persons.name: ScipioneBreislak
persons.description: Italian geologist of Swedish parentage. The vast works for the refining of sulphur in the volcanic district of Solfatara, near Naples, were erected under his direction. Professor of physics at the University of Ragusa, and subsequently at the Collegio Nazereno in Rome. He witnessed an eruption of Vesuvius in 1794 and subsequntly wrote Voyage Physique et Lithologique dans la Campagnie (1801).

persons.name: Déodat Gratet deDolomieu
persons.description: French geologist. The rock, and region of the Alps, dolomite was named after him.

places.name: Lipari
places.description: A commune including six of seven islands of the Aeolian Islands located in the Tyrrhenian Sea off the northern coast of Sicily in southern Italy.

places.name: Campania
places.description: A region of Italy; most of it is in the south-western portion of the Italian peninsula (with the Tyrrhenian Sea to its west), but it also includes the small Phlegraean Islands and the island of Capri.

persons.name: Alexander vonHumboldt
persons.description: German geographer, naturalist and explorer. ForMemRSL.

places.name: Andes
places.description: Mountain range in western South America.

places.name: Mount Vesuvius
places.description: Mount Vesuvius is a somma-stratovolcano located on the Gulf of Naples in Campania, Italy.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

persons.name: Giulio CesareBraccini
persons.description: An abbot from Lucca, Italy, who witnessed the 1631 eruption of Vesuvius, and wrote an account of it, Dell’incendio fattosi nel Vesuvio a’ XVI di dicembre M.DC.XXXI (Naples 1632).

persons.description: Swedish traveller and the archbishop of Uppsala. He travelled to Iceland with Joseph Banks.

places.name: Hekla
places.description: Hekla is a volcano in Iceland. It has erupted many times in recorded history. 1766-68 was the eruption closest to Davy's time.

persons.description: Italian geologist, active mainly in Sicily, and known especially for his vulcanology studies.

places.name: Torre del Greco
places.description: A comune in the Metropolitan City of Naples in Italy. Located at the foot of Mount Vesuvius, Torre del Greco was partly destroyed in an eruption of the volcano in 1631.

persons.description: King of Scotland 1649-1651. Became King of England, Scotland and Ireland in the 1660 Reformation until his death in 1685.

works.name: A true and exact relation of the late prodigious earthquake & eruption of Mount Aetna, or, Monte-Gibello ; as it came in a letter written to His Majesty from Naples by the Right Honorable the Earle of Winchilsea, His Majesties late ambassador at Constantinople, who in his return from thence, visiting Catania in the island of Sicily, was an ey-witness [sic] of that dreadfull spectacle.

persons.name: NicolasLemery
persons.description: French chemist, born at Rouen. He was one of the first to develop theories on acid-base chemistry.

places.name: Yorkshire
places.description: Yorkshire is a historic county in northern England and the largest by area size in the United Kingdom.

places.name: Ealand
places.description: English village in the county of Lincolnshire and the region of Yorkshire and the Humber.

persons.name: EvangelistaTorrecelli
persons.description: Italian natural philosopher and mathematician who invented the barometer. He was a student of Galileo.

persons.name: Charles-AugustinCoulomb
persons.description: French physicist best known for the torsion balance electrometer, which measured very small charges and estimated the attractive and repulsive forces between bodies.

persons.name: AbrahamBennet
persons.description: Natural philosopher and close associate with Priestley, Darwin and Wedgwood. He recorded atmospheric electricity. FRSL.
